author: Brian D. Scott
comment: Joseph stated the issue I'm running in to as well. The app is showing the check mark, but it does not consistently put the Moto 360 in the blank screen mode. I usually have to open the app, deselect then select the "on" feature. Is there something in the way of timing or the sensor that's causing the issue? When it works, it does work properly.
title: Moto 360 issues

author: Richard M
comment: I think you need to simplify the instructions a bit. At first I could not get it to work. But reading everyone's posts I figured it out. It seems that once it's set you need to have the screen on before you place it in the holder. If the screen is off it does not work.  Also make sure the app shows the check mark. I also was able to just say start slumber and it showed the app with the check mark. Placed it in the charger and the screen is dark.
title: Thanks, works great!

author: Eric Tom
comment: Installed it, opened the app on my Moto 360 once and saw check mark.  Placed it on the charger and screen immediately went dark.  Perfect!  I didn't really see any need to light up the screen with the clock and charge level, especially if there was a chance of screen burn in.  It's not an alarm clock after all.  I use the Gentle Alarm app on my Moto X and use it for my alarm clock on my nightstand  and it has a night display setting with anti burn in setting.
title: Perfectly simple solution!

author: steve betts
comment: Automatically blacks the screen  when watch is placed onto the charger. Actually some light does still leak out but it has to be really dark to see it. A simple analogue watch face would be a great option as i cant read digital without glasses
title: Works well on my Moto360

author: Andrew Haynes
comment: This app stopped working after my 2nd Gen Moto 360 updated to Marshmallow. It's been a while now so I hope a fix is coming soon. Love this app so will update to 5 stars when working again.
title: Doesn't work currently

author: Tracey S
comment: My moto 360 2nd gen doesn't charge when off & theatre mode doesn't work whilst charging - as I like a completely dark room this is fab for going to sleep, but it does come on (to a greyed out lit screen) during the night.
title: Doesn't work quite as expected on moto  360 2nd gen

author: Matt Lauber
comment: Pretty straight forward I think. Open the app on your watch and make sure you have a check mark. Simple as that and now the screen goes black every time. Its a shame we need to do this but I can't blame the app for that.
title: Works great

author: Joseph S. West
comment: Doesn't seem to work.  When u start the app on the phone for the first time are you supposed to hit the check mark to start it or leave the check mark alone.  I've tried both and neither seem to work.  Seem like you could make it more obvious like it is on or off or something.

reply.author: Joel Anderson
reply.content: Make sure the check mark shows. If it's the X, it won't work. Pretty simple.

title: Doesn't work on my Moto360

author: James Pepperell
comment: Blanks the screen while charging. However after a few minutes the screen lights up and stays on, although it is dim it's enough of a  desecration in a dark room. There is nothing on the screen its more of a dim back light. Yes I have the tick shown. Any advise?

author: Brandon Ezell
comment: Check mark is always enabled, but it never works the first time. I always have to take the watch off the charger and put it back on for it to work. Please fix and you'll earn 5 stars.
title: Inconsistent

author: Bryant Floyd
comment: It does work 👍 but, doesn't work automatically so you have launch the Slumber app manually before putting it on the charger. Slumber app stays on after you put it on the charger. I'm guessing this is a limitation of the Moto 360 (1 gen).
title: It work's 👍 but, manual start only

author: Andi Vargas
comment: For those that are having trouble, once you install the app on your phone, you must activate on your watch via "OK Google" and say "open slumber". Make sure it's √ and not X. That's it, enjoy!
title: Great App!

author: Troy Bauman
comment: Set up the app just as described. Set my watch on the charging pad, and success! Black screen. Looked back five minutes later and the charging screen was on. Using a Moto 360.
title: Works!..... Oh... No it doesn't.

author: Ben Hughes
comment: I've only scored this app one star as it turns the screen dark but not off. So in a darkened bedroom the watch is still lighting the room. It would be better if it just turn the screen off completely.
title: Dark room

author: Kevin Guest
comment: Great simple idea, pity it only works once. First time I installed it worked as stated. Next 3 days tried everything to activate when put on charger, then uninstalled and reinstalled, appeared to work first night but backlight was back on again by next morning
title: Problem with Moto 360

author: Jon Task
comment: I did rate this 2 stars originally because it was a pain to get working. Now for some reason (update I never noticed?) it works first time. It does everything its supposed to. Great app!
title: Updated to 5 stars.

author: Jason Allen
comment: This was a bit iffy on my first gen Moto 360.  Sometimes the charging display would keep popping up no matter how many times I started Slumber.  However, it works much better on my Huawei Watch 2.  I sometimes have to start the app manually, but the watch doesn't fight against it like the 360 did.

author: Miguel Ocando
comment: The app works but only if you open it on the watch, prior to EACH charge. (moto360) On occasion, I'll have to repeat the process until I get a dark screen. The developer mentions that "you need to open the app only once" in order to get a black screen during every charge. It deserves a 5 if issues can be fixed.
title: It works but...

author: Nathan Pilkington
comment: Despite other reviews saying this is hard or doesn't work, I downloaded it, tapped on my Moto 360, scrolled to Start, tapped Slumber, the circle was checked, and the screen went completely off when placed on the charger. Didn't need to use voice to open the app, no special configuration, just installed, opened, and started charging with blank screen. I'd say try it. Works as expected.
title: Worked fast and easy on Moto 360

author: Raymond Moore
comment: But it definitely doesn't work. I've tried rebooting my 360 after installing, and toggling the on/off several times but the display never fully turns off. Was this app developed on W1 or W2? My 360 is on W2.
title: Just What My 360 Needed...

author: Christopher Clark
comment: All this is, is an on/off button you access on your moto360. But neither the on nor the off button dims my screen when it's on the charger. If I could give this zero stars, I would. Worse than useless.
title: Worthless

author: David
comment: This is a feature which should be part of Android Wear, not a separate app.  I was thrilled when I saw this.  My only gripe is that the screen is not completely black when charging, there is still a slight glow.  If it could be completely black I would give 5 stars.
title: Just what I was looking for

author: Shaun Esther
comment: It works exactly as described on the Moto 360. All you need to do is open the app on you watch "start slumber" then dismiss it (don't click the checkmark) and charge your watch.
title: Working Fine

author: Thomas Moneyhon
comment: works exactly as stated. have to open the app on the WATCH one time. then drop on the charger and the screen will blank while charging.
title: stopping bad reviews

author: Luke Berry
comment: Got the moto 360, really appreciate the app. Just random times when I place it on it doesn't work. after taking it off/restarting it often starts to work
title: Great - when it works

author: James H
comment: At first I was unable to get it to work even after following the instructions and trying things others had posted. Finally I opened the app on the phone again. Swiped to close it after making sure it was checked and now it works!
title: Finally works

author: David Taylor
comment: This does exactly what it says it does and the activation is as straight forward as it gets - an 'x' is off, a check is on. However, the setup/activation doesn't necessarily work on the first try, or, in my case with the 360, even on the third try. I had to uninstall, re-install and open the application several times before the functionality activated. It's not a huge issue, but I had just about given up before it finally worked.
title: Works as stated. Though, with some hiccups.

author: Rahul Srinivasa
comment: - Install the Slumber app.  - Open the app from the watch. Should be fine if you open the app using any launchers too.  - Make sure a tick is seen, this indicates the screen will go blank.  - You can close the app or leave it open, doesn't matter.  - Put it on the charging dock. Screen will go blank.   Note - Even if you touch the screen slightly while it is docked it will display the info. If you leave it on dock after any screen touch watch will not go blank. Sometimes the first time you place on dock it will not go blank.  You will have to undock and redock till the watch goes blank. Usually will happen on the second try for sure.
title: Instructions for Moto 360.

author: Victor Sanchez
comment: Stopped working on my 360 after a few days. I ended up enabling developer options on watch and enabled turn off display while charging
title: Used to work

author: Jamie Gaskell
comment: Easy app to use,  didn't work properly at first as screen would come on part way through charging. Restarting the watch fixed the problem
title: Works great

author: Jared Leith
comment: Does nothing on my Lg G R. Yes I opened it. I am no noob to Android.

reply.author: Joel Anderson
reply.content: Did you open the app first?

title: Not working

author: Chad Walker
comment: The app has crashed or caused others to crash at random times. That being said, I'll deal with that over having the watch beam my face when I'm trying to sleep. Plus it prevents the image burn others have reported. Thanks for taking the time to code a useful feature that should've been included. Motorola should be paying you IMO!
title: Useful for light sleepers

author: Jonathan Nicolosi
comment: I like the idea, and I'm very tech savvy, however I cannot get this open as an application or work on my moto 360 which I just purchased. I may be new to the watch, may be due to user error, help?

author: Chris Seay
comment: After just buying a Moto360, I prayed this app would work.  It works perfectly.  You must go into the watch(Okay Google-Start-Slumber) to make sure it is on.  After that everything is perfect.
title: Perfect!

author: mathew brown
comment: This worked on my moto 360 before. I got a new phone and now it does nothing. Pls fix as it was great before. HTC m8 and moto 360
title: Doesn't work anymore

author: Jared Denman
comment: Doesn't work anymore after the 5.0.1 update on moto360. Doesn't even show up as an app on my 360. Please fix I loved this app! *even after uninstalling and reinstalling it still doesn't work.  Deleting it and moving on. Maybe 1 day it will work again*
title: Doesn't work

author: Juan Madrigal
comment: This product is amazing and great for people who are looking for a black out charge screen. Not only is it installed right away on your android wear--once synced-- but the option is also available to check off during AWear use. Moto 360 has been a victim of burn in issues and like every other tech freak, new issues brought upon the community, scare the heck out of me and put me in paranoid mode.                           I don't usually review apps, but slumbers simple UI and hassle free install deserves
title: Works flawlessly. Confusion from the mass?

author: Rob V
comment: Turn on Theatre Mode before setting your watch on the charger and the screen goes black. Problem solved, app uninstalled.
title: Didn't work.  Easy fix.

author: Nam-John Nguyen
comment: I gave up using this app when it was a 50/50 chance of having the screen off while charging.   Then I found out (by mistake)  that if I turn on "theater mode" and then put it on the dock the screen would go blank, then off and still charge.   No need for the app now.
title: Some times worked some time didn't.

author: DosMan Dan
comment: I tried for a while, rebooted watch, resync and just gave up. The developer responded quickly and I realized I didn't know how to run an app on the Moto. After some searching, found out you need to say 'Ok Google' then scroll down to Start. Now it works, user error.
title: Ok, new to Moto, not developer's fault
